channel.title: Projects on Meet Ghadiyali
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Meet Ghadiyali

item.title: Project 1: E - Commerce Exploratory Analysis
item.description: • Using data to conduct exploratory analysis on an international e-commerce company. • Derived key insights from the customer database. • Plotted Bar, Pie, Box and Heat graphs for the analysis. • Used Jupyter Notebook for the analysis. • Data Input was a csv file. Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 2: T20 Cricket - Descriptive Sports Analysis
item.description: • Analysis of the Indian Cricket Team’s 2018 and 2019 International 20-over Cricket matches. • Used a different approach of analyzing commentary (word descriptions) instead of plain numerical data. • Commentary about the game gives lot of interesting insights other than the usual runs and wickets. • Plotted graphs to answer various questions pertaining to the matches and made the appropriate inferences. • Used Jupyter Notebook for the analysis. • Plotted Bar Graphs for the analysis.

item.title: Project 3: Canadian Immigration: Analysis (1980 - 2013)
item.description: • Using data to analyze Canada’s Immigration. • Analyzed the data to understand Canada’s immigration from the 1980’s to 2013. • Plotted Line and Bar graphs. • Used Jupyter Notebook for the analysis. • Data Input was a csv file. Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 4: Cricket Analysis: Using Tableau
item.description: • Using the Tableau software to analyze cricket data and answer a few key questions. • Data was used from https://cricsheet.org/ Tableau Public Workbook: https://public.tableau.com/profile/meet.ghadiyali#!/vizhome/Cricket-Analysis/Dashboard1 Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 5: Sales Analysis: Predictive Data Analysis
item.description: • Using this for the purpose of Predictive Data Analysis. • Used the data to analyze different aspects of sales at the supermarket. • Derived key insights from the tables and graphs plotted. • Plotted Bar, Line, Pie Graphs for the analysis. • Used Jupyter Notebook for the analysis. • Data Input was a csv file. Link to GitHub Repository
